intro: Dasymalla chorisepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dasymalla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
